description: The Syrian government originally ordered the closure of universities, schools and institutions from March 14 to April 2 but has decided to extend this on May 6 and reopen universities and institutions as of May 31, 2020. UPDATE: The Syrian government originally ordered the closure of universities, schools and institutions from March 14 to April 2 but decided on Wednesday, 6 May to extend this reopen universities and institutions as of May 31, 2020.

description: The Syrian Health Ministry announced on March 24, 2020, a nationwide night curfew from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m. as a lockdown measure which will take effect on 25 March 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: The Syrian government, in charge of confronting the Coronavirus (COVID-19) announced on the 18th of April the alteration of the curfew duration across the country during the month of Ramadan, making it from 7:30 PM to 6 AM, while maintaining the restriction of movement between city centers and rural areas and between provinces. UPDATE: The Syrian government, in charge of confronting the Coronavirus (COVID-19) altered the curfew duration across the country during the month of Ramadan, making it from 7:30 PM to 6 AM, while maintaining the restriction of movement between city centers and rural areas and between provinces.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On March 20, 2020, the Syrian Government banned entry for foreigners, after the first coronavirus victim reached Syria by road from Lebanon after returning from Europe.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On March 20, 2020, the Syrian Government employed medical teams at the national level and 1,864 health clinics across the country.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: On March 23, 2020, the Syrian Government stepped up procedures for the supposed response to the epidemic by carrying out campaigns to sterilize cities and villages.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Syrian Government decided on a curfew to prevent the movement of citizens between centres of cities and countryside which came into effect on the 31st of March and is set to last until the 16th of April.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
The Syrian Interior Ministry extended the curfew among provinces which prevents the commuting of citizens between province centres and all other urban and rural areas at all times excluding those with clearance 
set to last until April 16 to May 2nd. UPDATE: The original travel restriction referred to under the curfew measure by the Syrian government set to last until April 16 has been extended to May 2.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: The Syrian Government with the curfew still in place until May 2nd has decided to allow citizens to travel among provinces on the 20th and 21st of April after putting medical teams at the entrance of each province. UPDATE: Curfew among provinces is still enforced until May 2 but the government is making an exception and allowing citizens to travel among provinces on the 20th and 21st of April.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: The government in Syria ordered the closing of restaurants, cafes and other businesses, and has halted public transportation on Sunday March 22, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 28 April, 2020, the Syrian Health Ministry launched a service on its website which shows the distribution of registered Coronavirus cases in Syria, sorting them by provinces, age groups, gender, and cause of infection. The service also contains information on the 5 official labs that conduct COVID-19 tests, and the centers for quarantine and isolation.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: On March 18, the Recruitment Directorate affiliated with the Syria regime forces announced the suspension of the issuance of driver's licenses and military service completion attestations until April 22.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: On March 20, the Ministry of Religious Endowments decided to close all directorates and divisions from March 22 to April 2.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
